hero.title: The desktop app every Alfresco admin deserves
hero.description: NodeRef unifies the Node Browser, JavaScript Console, search and server management in one focused desktop app. Your daily Alfresco work becomes clearer, faster, and far less time consuming.

features.title: A full set of tools that make Alfresco administration much smoother
features.description: Search faster, inspect nodes in detail, review logs, run scripts, and manage multiple servers without jumping between tools.

dashboardActivity.title: Activity overview
dashboardActivity.description: See where you've been with a personal dashboard showing recent nodes in a timeline and heatmap, so you can quickly jump back into recent work.

queryBuilder.title: Query builder
queryBuilder.description: Build powerful searches on properties, aspects, types, paths, and sites without memorizing every query detail.

savedSearches.title: Saved and recent searches
savedSearches.description: Save your favourite queries with custom result columns, reuse them across servers, and rerun recent searches with a single click.

multiServer.title: Multi server workspace
multiServer.description: Connect prod, test, and dev, label each server, jump to admin tools, and read logs from one central desktop app.

jsConsole.title: Powerful JavaScript console
jsConsole.description: Run scripts against one or many servers with history, Monaco editor, Alfresco-specific helpers, and optional /ai assistance when you need it.

nodeBrowserTabs.title: Tabbed node browser
nodeBrowserTabs.description: Open multiple nodes in tabs, compare structures, follow references, and debug issues without losing your place.

fileViewerEditor.title: File viewer and editor
fileViewerEditor.description: Inspect and edit JavaScript and other text based content directly from the repository browser.

systemTree.title: System tree insight
systemTree.description: Browse users, permissions, groups, and remote credentials per server in a clear system tree view.

personalization.title: Your workspace, your way
personalization.description: Use light or dark mode, switch languages, and keep your own scripts and text files organised in one place.

featureShowcase.title: NodeRef in action
featureShowcase.description: Execute scripts across servers, search every environment, and keep the Node Browser tabs aligned without losing focus.

executeJs.title: Execute JavaScript on every server
executeJs.description: Queue the same script for production, staging, and dev, view each result inline, and keep your history organised without juggling browsers.

searchMultiServer.title: Search across multiple servers
searchMultiServer.description: Fire saved queries to one or more environments, compare hits side by side, and save focus with smart filters and pinned results.

nodeBrowser.title: Navigate the Node Browser with tabs
nodeBrowser.description: Open nodes in tabs, follow references, and compare structures without losing your place while checking permissions or content.

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.description: Any questions? Create an issue on GitHub and we’ll take a look.

whatIsNodeRef.question: What is NodeRef?
whatIsNodeRef.answer: It's a standalone desktop app that brings the Node Browser, JavaScript Console, search, logs, and multi-server tools together in one place.

consoleModule.question: Do I need a module installed on Alfresco?
consoleModule.answer: Yes. For all features to work, your Alfresco server needs the <supportToolsLink>OOTBee Support Tools</supportToolsLink> module. NodeRef uses its JavaScript Console and related endpoints.

whyDesktop.question: Why use a desktop app?
whyDesktop.answer: Because everything stays in one workspace. No lost tabs, no clutter, and tools that work together instead of separately.

multiServer.question: Can I connect more than one server?
multiServer.answer: Yes. Add as many servers as you want, label them clearly, switch instantly, and run scripts across several at once.

cost.question: Is NodeRef free?
cost.answer: Yes. It's free for the entire Alfresco community.

community.question: Who is NodeRef for?
community.answer: Admins, developers, support engineers, and anyone who spends time digging through nodes or managing multiple Alfresco servers.
